title-group.article-title: VALUES OF THE EULER ø-FUNCTION NOT DIVISIBLE BY A GIVEN ODD PRIME, AND THE DISTRIBUTION OF EULER-KRONECKER CONSTANTS FOR CYCLOTOMIC FIELDS

abstract.p: Let ø denote Euler's phi function. For a fixed odd prime q we investigate the first and second order terms of the asymptotic series expansion for the number of n ⩽ x such that q ∤ ø(n). Part of the analysis involves a careful study of the Euler-Kronecker constants for cyclotomic fields. In particular, we show that the Hardy-Littlewood conjecture about counts of prime k-tuples and a conjecture of Ihara about the distribution of these EulerKronecker constants cannot be both true.
